blogs.title: 2 Nearby Towns. 25-Fold Different Stomach Cancer Rates. Why?
blogs.summary: One of our oldest companions is a microbe called Helicobacter pylori. It has been colonising our stomachs, and co-evolving with us, for the past 100,000 years. It was with us when were still confined to Africa, and came along for the ride as we spread thro

author.name: Phenomena » Not Exactly Rocket Science
author.description: A science salon hosted by National Geographic Magazine

blogs.title: News digest – rise in cancer cases, cervical screening, ‘genetic reshuffling’ and more
blogs.summary: A third of a million people are now diagnosed with cancer every year, according to our latest figures. This equates to an increase of nearly 50,000 diagnoses over the last 10 years, but thanks to research more people are surviving cancer than ever before.

news.title: Famous Ancient Iceman Had Familiar Stomach Infection
news.summary: Researchers have extracted the oldest complete genome sequence of a pathogen yet, from the body of the 5,300-year-old ice mummy Ötzi.

news.title: Famous ancient iceman had familiar stomach infection
news.summary: EURAC/Marion Lafogler The ice mummy dubbed Ötzi has been studied extensively since he was found in 1991.
